intro: Allosidastrum hilarianum, commonly known as the Hilarian thornveld, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its spiny stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Allosidastrum hilarianum is often found in rocky soils and is a component of the fynbos vegetation type.
